definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods

sentences.english: It's another spring day so bright.
Chunguang everywhere are beautiful, the Qingming vegetation Germinating scene.
sentences.chinese: 到處是春光明媚，草木萌動的清明景象。

sentences.english: On a fine spring day like this I feel quite carefree.
sentences.chinese: 在春光明媚的日子裏，我感到非常舒暢。

sentences.english: Even if the bright spring, my heart is still dark.
sentences.chinese: 即使春光明媚，我的心還是黑暗。

sentences.english: Spring is gay with flower and song.

sentences.chinese: 然而，四月的春天春光明媚。

sentences.english: It was beautiful spring weather, but neither dogs nor humans were aware of it.
sentences.chinese: 已是春光明媚時節，然而不論狗或者人都未曾察覺。

definition: moderate wind, beautiful sun (idiom); fine sunny weather, esp. in springtime
green willow and red flowers/all the colors of spring
red flowers and green willow/all the colors of spring
see 秋高氣爽|秋高气爽[qiu1 gao1 qi4 shuang3]
to go for a hike in spring
Chunri or Chunjih township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
lit. birdsong and fragrant flowers (idiom); fig. the intoxication of a beautiful spring day
